intro: Acilepis ngaoensis, commonly known as the Ngao mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassland habitats at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
